description: 1 if the service is healthy, 0 otherwise
Milliseconds taken to complete a query.
Number of bytes returned in query response.
Milliseconds taken to query individual historical/realtime processes.
Time to first byte. Milliseconds elapsed until Broker starts receiving the response from individual historical/realtime processes.
Number of bytes returned from querying individual historical/realtime processes.
Milliseconds that the channel to this process has spent suspended due to backpressure.

Only emitted if interval chunking is enabled. Milliseconds required to query an interval chunk. This metric is deprecated and will be removed in the future because interval Chunking is deprecated. See Query Context.
Milliseconds taken to query individual segment. Includes time to page in the segment from disk.
Milliseconds spent waiting for a segment to be scanned.
Number of segments in queue waiting to be scanned.
Milliseconds taken to query individual segment or hit the cache (if it is enabled on the Historical process).
Microseconds of CPU time taken to complete a query.
Number of total queries.
Number of queries successfully processed.
Number of failed queries.
Number of queries interrupted due to cancellation or timeout.
Delta number of cache entries.
Delta size in bytes of cache entries.
Delta number of cache hits.
Delta number of cache misses.
Delta number of cache evictions.
Delta cache hit rate.
Delta average cache entry byte size.
Delta number of cache timeouts.
Delta number of cache errors.
Total number of cache entries.
Total size in bytes of cache entries.
Total number of cache hits.
Total number of cache misses.
Total number of cache evictions.
Total cache hit rate.
Total average cache entry byte size.
Total number of cache timeouts.
Total number of cache errors.
Number of events rejected because they are outside the windowPeriod.
Number of events rejected because the events are unparseable.
Number of events rejected because the events are duplicated.
Number of events successfully processed per emission period.
Time gap between the data time in event and current system time.
Number of Druid rows persisted.
Number of times persist occurred.
Milliseconds spent doing intermediate persist.
Cpu time in Nanoseconds spent on doing intermediate persist.
Milliseconds spent creating persist tasks and blocking waiting for them to finish.
Number of persists that failed.
Number of handoffs that failed.
Milliseconds spent merging intermediate segments.
Cpu time in Nanoseconds spent on merging intermediate segments.
Total lag between the offsets consumed by the Kafka indexing tasks and latest offsets in Kafka brokers across all partitions. Minimum emission period for this metric is a Minute. In millisecond.
Max lag between the offsets consumed by the Kafka indexing tasks and latest offsets in Kafka brokers across all partitions. Minimum emission period for this metric is a Minute. In millisecond.
Average lag between the offsets consumed by the Kafka indexing tasks and latest offsets in Kafka brokers across all partitions. Minimum emission period for this metric is a Minute. In millisecond.
Number of successful tasks per emission period. This metric is only available if the TaskCountStatsMonitor module is included.
Number of failed tasks per emission period. This metric is only available if the TaskCountStatsMonitor module is included.
Number of current running tasks. This metric is only available if the TaskCountStatsMonitor module is included.
Number of current pending tasks. This metric is only available if the TaskCountStatsMonitor module is included.
Number of current waiting tasks. This metric is only available if the TaskCountStatsMonitor module is included.
Milliseconds taken to run a task.
Size in bytes of new segments created.
Size in bytes of segments moved/archived via the Move Task.
Size in bytes of segments deleted via the Kill Task.
Number of segments assigned to be loaded in the cluster.
Number of segments moved in the cluster.
Number of segments dropped due to being overshadowed.
Number of segments dropped due to rules.
Number of segments dropped due to being marked as unused.
Number of segments (not including replicas) left to load until segments that should be loaded in the cluster are available for queries.
Number of segments (including replicas) left to load until segments that should be loaded in the cluster are available for queries.
Used in cost balancing. The raw cost of hosting segments.
Used in cost balancing. The normalization of hosting segments.
Used in cost balancing. The normalized cost of hosting segments.
Size in bytes of segments to load.
Number of segments that failed to load.
Number of segments to load.
Number of segments to drop.
Size in bytes of available segments.
Number of overShadowed segments.
Maximum byte limit available for segments.
Bytes used for served segments.
Percentage of space used by served segments.
On-disk size in bytes of segments that are waiting to be cleared out.
Committed pool in byte.
Initial pool in bytes.
Max pool in bytes.
Pool used in bytes.
Bufferpool count in bytes.
Bufferpool used in bytes.
Bufferpool capacity in bytes.
Initial memory in bytes.
Max memory in bytes.
Used memory in bytes.
Committed memory in bytes.
Garbage collection count.
Cpu time in Nanoseconds spent on garbage collection.
Number of events queued in the EventReceiverFirehose's buffer.

Max swap in bytes.

Paged out swap.

Reads from disk.

Bytes read from disk. Can we used to determine how much paging is occuring with regards to segments.

Bytes read from the network.
